page.title: 15Farming
page.content: Farming around here is mixed farming, i.e. sheep,cattle and cereal growing. The trend is toward arable farming, particularly on the larger farms which can cope with and afford the necessary heavy machinery.Winter wheat and barley is being used increasingly.A typical mixed farm of 200 acres might have 90% sheep,5%cattle and 5% barley. The barley would be used to feed the beasts and any surplus sold.All livestock is raised for slaughter. There are trends in farming.Potatoes are on the increase but still regarded as a minor crop. Oilseed rape was being tried but one farmer thought it merely"a flash in the pan."Livestock farming is much more profitable than arable.The use of larger machines means a downward trend in the numbers of men employed. Newtown has a herd of dairy cattle.
